title: Welcome
text: This is my first post on the new website. There will likely be some back-dated posts migrated to this location but I’ll use it as a place to share data-related posts, to document races/competitions, and to inevitably post dog pictures…the real purpose of the internet. Welcome!

title: Jeremy Provance, PhD
text:
Hey, I’m Jeremy!
My day job involves working with data at Adela as a clinical data manager. Adela’s mission is to develop technology to use simple blood draws to detect, diagnose, and manage cancer with an emphasis on early detection.
I love all things data: wrangling, visualizing, and communicating it. I have worked with data sets big and small, public and proprietary, clinical and clinical-adjacent. I spend most of my time in RStudio using RMarkdown documents to do my work. I used Quarto in RStudio to make this website!
Before I was at Adela, I completed a master’s and doctorate in bioinformatics at the UMKC School of Medicine and completed postdoctoral work at Yale School of Medicine.
Outside of work, I love to run and cycle and often tinker with my data to track and visualize performance and progress. I spend a lot of time hiking with my wife, Olivia, who is an oncology postdoc at Yale and my two dogs (who have both earned ceremonial dog-torates) Luna and Otto.
